description: Grade 1 Coding - Introduction to Scratch Jr

project_templates.tagline: Make a parade of animals march across the screen!
project_templates.why_exciting: Watching animals march in a parade is fun!

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: The animals are having a parade! But marching is TIRING. Instead of saying 'step step step step', let's use a LOOP!

teaching_script.gigi_says: A LOOP does something over and over. Instead of 'move move move move', we say 'repeat 4 times: move'!
teaching_script.voice_text: Instead of writing move four times, we put it in a loop! Repeat 4 times: move. Done!

rule_card.title: Loops (Repeat)
rule_card.rule: A loop repeats code. REPEAT [number] does something that many times!

challenges.prompt: Make the elephant march 5 steps using a loop

tier1.teach: Put 'move right' inside 'repeat 5'. The elephant will move 5 times!

phase_6_complete.celebration: Your animal parade is marching! Loops are awesome!

project_templates.tagline: Tap the animals and watch magic happen!
project_templates.why_exciting: Tapping and seeing instant reaction is magical

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: What if you could tap a cat and make it MEOW? Or tap a frog and make it JUMP? That's the power of EVENTS!

teaching_script.gigi_says: An EVENT is when something happens. 'When tapped' means when you touch it!
teaching_script.voice_text: When I tap the cat - MEOW! The 'when tapped' block waits for your tap, then runs the code!

rule_card.title: Events
rule_card.rule: 'When tapped' waits for you to touch something, THEN runs the code

challenges.prompt: When the frog is tapped, make it jump
When the star is tapped, make it spin around

phase_6_complete.celebration: Everything responds to your touch! You understand events!

project_templates.tagline: Design your perfect pet with different looks!

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: Let's create your own pet! You can choose how it looks, what it wears, and where it lives!

teaching_script.gigi_says: SPRITES are the characters in your project. BACKGROUNDS are where they live!
teaching_script.voice_text: Pick your sprite - that's your pet! Pick your background - that's where it lives!

challenges.prompt: Add a sprite and choose what animal you want
Where does your pet live? Choose a background!

phase_6_complete.celebration: Your pet looks amazing in their new home!

project_templates.tagline: Help the bunny win the race!
project_templates.what_kids_build: A bunny that follows a path to finish line

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: The bunny wants to win the race! But it needs YOUR plan to get there. That plan is called an ALGORITHM!

teaching_script.gigi_says: An ALGORITHM is a step-by-step plan to solve a problem!
teaching_script.voice_text: Our algorithm: move right 3, up 2, right 1. That's the plan to reach the carrot!

rule_card.title: Algorithms
rule_card.rule: An algorithm is a step-by-step plan to solve a problem
rule_card.example: Problem: Get to school. Algorithm: Wake up ‚Üí Get dressed ‚Üí Eat ‚Üí Walk to school

challenges.prompt: Bunny needs to go: right 2, down 1, right 3. Put the steps in order!

phase_6_complete.celebration: The bunny won the race thanks to your algorithm!

project_templates.tagline: The game is broken! Can you debug it?
project_templates.what_kids_build: Find and fix bugs in simple Scratch Jr projects
project_templates.why_exciting: Being the expert who fixes things

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: Oh no! This game doesn't work right! The cat is supposed to meow when tapped, but it's spinning instead! Let's find the BUG!

teaching_script.gigi_says: DEBUGGING means finding what's wrong and fixing it!
teaching_script.voice_text: The code says turn around, but we want it to meow! Wrong block! Let's fix it!

challenges.prompt: Dog should bark but it's meowing! Find the wrong block.
Bird should fly UP but it's going DOWN! Fix it.

phase_6_complete.celebration: You debugged all the games! You're a bug-squashing hero!

summary.theme_consistency: Animals and simple characters appropriate for 6-year-olds
